item.title: My 5 Frontend Tools That No Project Can Do Without
item.description:
As a frontend leader, I try to build processes so that the code is predictable and the team is on the same wavelength. One way is to fix a set of tools that solves 80% of tasks without unnecessary experimentation. Here is my current stack; it evolves, but the base remains.

  1. VS Code

    An editor who doesn’t distract. ESLint + Prettier are embedded in save, the terminal is nearby, Git Lens shows the history directly in the file. No “it doesn’t work for me” â€” settings in the repository.
